intro: Sphenantha, commonly known as the rock fern, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, often creeping stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plants typically grow in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Sphenantha species are known for their ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making them resilient and adaptable. Their flowers are usually small and inconspicuous, often clustered in dense inflorescences.
